item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

To answer your question, make sure you’re actually saving the playerIsMember variable when the player logs out, and loading it correctly upon login, otherwise it’s just going to reset to default.

Also I’d advise using a boolean, as there are only two possible outcomes, being a member, or not being a member.

If I use the command ::membership (username) then that player becomes a member. But whenever they log out, it resets. For some reason my playerIsMemer = 1 doesn’t save, and just resets to 0. Can anyone help me out? Thanks

[code] if (command.startsWith(“membership”) && playerRights >= 2) {
String member = command.substring(11);

        sendMessage("Player " + member + " has become a Gold Member!");

        for (int a = 1; a < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers; a++) {

                if (PlayerHandler.players[a].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(
                        member)) {
                    PlayerHandler.players[a].playerIsMember = 1;
